data.title: Updated to MaxMind.GeoIP2 2.5.0 and .NET 4.5.2
data.body:
Depends on https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/10279.

This has several benefits for proper Linux packaging #8264:
- Library gets a strong name so it can be installed into GAC.
- Removes the dependency on RestSharp

data.title: Updated to .NET 4.5
data.body: On August 7, 2014, Microsoft announced that support will end for .NET Framework 4, 4.5, and 4.5.1 on January 12, 2016. https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/lifecycle?C2=548

data.title: Deviator tanks don't seem to work on release-20151224
data.body:
I played several games against Ordos, with a constant stream of Deviators coming my way, but I didn't see a single one of my units have it's owner changed.
I suspect the (somewhat) recently added inaccuracy doesn't play well with their small damage spread, and the targets don't get affected at all by the gas.

data.title: Updated to Mono 4.2
data.body: http://www.mono-project.com/docs/about-mono/releases/4.2.1/ as far as I see this is just improving compatibilty with .NET and fixing bugs.

data.title: Update INSTALL.md linux build instructions
data.body: Added 'make version' And some instructions on building stable

data.title: Speed up dictionaries keyed on Player
data.body:
Adds a specialized collection, `PlayerDictionary`, that also stores state in an array accessible by player index. By relying on the fact the players in the world never change, in some performance sensitive parts of the code we can exchange slower dictionary access for speedier array accesses instead. This change was already made in #10126 - I am now expanding it into a few other areas, so I've created a dedicated object for it.

This change reduces CPU used in the RA shellmap from 1.75% to 0.74% in the affected methods (`FrozenUnderFog.Tick`, `FrozenUnderFog.TickRender` and `GpsDot.Tick`)

data.title: Support sending sequences of points when drawing lines
data.body:
This allows the graph widgets to avoid having to create temporary arrays just to draw these lines, which reduces GC pressure.

On the RA shellmap with the perf graph active, this reduces ongoing allocations by about 9%.

data.title: Remove some unneeded PerfSamples
data.body: These don't really measure anything of value, and removing them helps declutter things a little.

data.title: Load shaders relative to the game directory, rather than the CWD
data.body:
If OpenRA is started with a current working directory that does not match the path to the game, then loading shaders will fail. By using a path relative to the game directory, we can successfully start the game with different working directories.

(I'm mostly scratching my own itch here - the memory profiler I use changes the working directory and thus gives me exceptions like `System.IO.DirectoryNotFoundException: Could not find a part of the path 'C:\Users\Roost\CLRProfiler\32\glsl\shp.vert'.`)

data.title: Actors defined in map.yaml aren't shown in the actor selection box of the map editor
Adjust the description of allies05a
data.body:
To prevent issues like #10226 and #10265.
-> Fixes #10265.

In addition we could disguise the spy automatically at mission start, if you feel like this change in the description is not enough.

data.title: Paradrop Production
data.body: I've been working on this for a little bit. It's a Production trait in the vein of ProductionAirdrop that paradrops the unit being produced. I think it still needs audio but seems to work well otherwise. I'll do some more independent testing but I figured I'd open up a pull request anyhow and get some input.

data.title: Spy gets shot
data.body: OpenRA.exe ver 12/13/2015. Mission 5a, Tanya's Tale: spy gets noticed and shot by soldiers.

data.title: Restart button for missions
data.body:
This Addresses #4874 and follows on Pull Request #7411
Adds a restart button to the abort menu and end game menu to allow restarting of the mission
Fixes bug in Pull Request #7411 that prevented new replay files from being created for restarted missions and crashes in the resulting single file.

data.title: Move "Other" group in spectator shroud selector to the top
data.body:
When there are a lot of players, it is necessary to scroll down in the spectator shroud selection list in order to reach "All Players" and "Disable Shroud" options. It would be better if these were listed first.

![shroud_selector](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6599106/11964376/ee8a94bc-a8f5-11e5-91e9-cc07c6bfb3d4.png)

data.title: please make the map editor more user friendly
data.body: Hey, it would be awsome if you could add some bigger brushes for water and terrain. Its so anoing to paint with 1x1

data.title: Exception of type `System.IO.EndOfStreamException`: Attempted to read past the end of the stream.
data.body:
My game is keep crashing, still after re installation... Athlon X2 215 + Geforce 7200 - Windows 7 32bit

Red Alert Mod at Version release-20150919
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34209
Exception of type `System.IO.EndOfStreamException`: Attempted to read past the end of the stream.
   at OpenRA.StreamExts.ReadBytes(Stream s, Byte[] buffer, Int32 offset, Int32 count)
   at OpenRA.StreamExts.ReadBytes(Stream s, Int32 count)
   at OpenRA.StreamExts.ReadUInt32(Stream s)
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.MixFile.ReadBlocks(Stream s, Int64 offset, Int32 count)
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.MixFile.DecryptHeader(Stream s, Int64 offset, Int64& headerEnd)
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.MixFile..ctor(String filename, PackageHashType type, Int32 priority)
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.GlobalFileSystem.OpenPackage(String filename, String annotation, Int32 order)
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.GlobalFileSystem.<Mount>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__0()
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.GlobalFileSystem.Mount(String name, String annotation)
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.GlobalFileSystem.LoadFromManifest(Manifest manifest)
   at OpenRA.ModData.PrepareMap(String uid)
   at OpenRA.Game.StartGame(String mapUID, WorldType type)
   at OpenRA.Game.LoadShellMap()
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.LoadScreens.BlankLoadScreen.StartGame(Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Game.InitializeMod(String mod, Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

data.title: Factor silos needed warning to a new trait.
data.body: This was requested in #10075

data.title: A Few Noticed Issues
data.body:
Firstly I have noticed an issue with the mouse flickering at the top of the screen (about top 80%) when using the Ubuntu Build.

Secondly I also noticed that the commando is GDI only, they use multi engineer,  the missions are done using only 4 tech levels and you only have 6 missions for each side, I think the way missions are run for NOD and GDI will interfere with later missions then have been implemented and would like to see the ability to choose the next mission from the map like in the original.

Thirdly I would like to see a third side, the Scrin in the classic Command And Conquer Tiberium Dawn.

data.title: DeployToUpgrade: Deploy Animations processed before starting deploy
data.body:
When trying to implement the Allied G.I.'s Deploy function at this PR:
https://github.com/OpenRA/ra2/pull/3
I noticed that DeployToUpgrade wasn't wanting to render the DeployAnimation.

This fixes that issue, by causing the DeployAnimation to render before the rest of the effects of the Deploy/Undeploy.

The only other unit in the entire project to use DeployToUpgrade is the Dune 2000 Thumper unit, and they do not have a DeployAnimation, and are therefore unaffected.

data.title: Change of building palette order (cnc)
data.body:
I already wrote a post on this with images:
http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=19220&postdays=0&postorder=asc&vote=viewresult
basically changing the positions of the buildings so that they follow the technology path (and look better)

i'll post the building palette order here:
NUK2: 80
PYLE/HAND: 30
WEAP/AFLD: 40
HPAD: 50
FIX: 60
- note i did not post the ones that did not need to be changed

data.title: Spatially partition frozen actors
data.body:
Like other parts of the engine, this PR now tracks change in the shroud so it only had to update frozen actors on the map in areas where the shroud may have changed, rather than needing to update them all.

On the RA shellmap, this reduces CPU time spent in FrozenActorLayer.Tick from 2.32% to 1.51%. (For comparison - this is our most expensive trait to tick at the moment, the next worst is RenderSprites at 1.46%)

Closes #9614.

data.title: Enable original TD campaign colors.
data.body:
Closes #8517 and fixes some generic tooltip issues caused by missing default overrides.

Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/10268.

data.title: Change labels in the game-lobby (chat) - from 'Lobby/Global' to 'Game/Lobby'
data.body:
As discussed in this forum thread:
http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=293879#293879

This would change the labels 'Lobby' with 'Game' and 'Global' with 'Lobby'. It just feel right since the 'Lobby' is where I go to find me a 'Game'.

data.title: Add options to re-size the lobby window.
data.body:
I love the functionality of the new lobby window but it's starting to look a bit crowded. It could be nice to have an option to increase the size (Skirmish, Missions, Multiplayer, Settings, everything in Extra) to accommodate additional options into an open and clean design. I'm sure that would be useful for future additions as well.

data.title: Remove obsolete TransformOnPassenger trait
data.body: Partially to avoid future confusion like https://github.com/Phrohdoh/OpenRA/pull/84.

data.title: Remove ISpriteBody
data.body:
> 16:19:51 (abcdefg30) why do we even have ISpriteBody when it's only implemented by WithSpriteBody ?
> 16:20:08 (pchote) it was there while we were transitioning to WithSpriteBody
> 16:20:18 (pchote) the old Render*'s used to implement it too
> 16:20:23 (abcdefg30) ah, so basically i can remove it?
> 16:20:31 (pchote) should be able to
